properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain to end the week. A low pressure system from the American Midwest will bring rain beginning on Thursday over Western Quebec, and move into Central Quebec on Friday. A total of 20 to 40 millimetres of rain is expected through Saturday morning. Since spring freshet has not ended in some areas, flooding is possible in the most vulnerable areas. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-09T03:19:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-08T19:20:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2491230939.2019

properties.Title: Update: Flood Warning Continues For The Red River From Emerson To The Red River Floodway Channel Inlet
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre continues to issue a Flood Warning on the Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet due to high water flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions given by local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-05-09T11:00:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-05-08T15:22:16-05:00, BF8EA038-2399-6EEA-7ABA-C1A7D6D30C91
Area: Red River from Emerson to the Red River Floodway channel inlet
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain and snow tonight through Thursday. A strong low pressure system will track over Northeastern Ontario on Thursday. Rain or snow ahead of this system will begin tonight and continue Thursday before tapering to scattered showers or drizzle Thursday night into Friday. Total precipitation amounts of 20 to 40 mm are expected however with temperatures remaining just above the freezing mark, many areas will also mix with snow. As a result, rainfall amounts in these areas will be reduced with snowfall accumulations of 5 to 10 cm possible. The locations which are likely to receive mostly rain are from near Wawa to New Liskeard and south. The ground, still partially frozen, has limited ability to absorb rainfall. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings may be required. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local conservation authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District Office. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-09T03:52:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-08T19:53:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2455097218.2019
Area: White River - Dubreuilville, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Chapleau - Missinaibi Lake, Gogama - Foleyet, Kirkland Lake - Englehart, New Liskeard - Temagami
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For Douglas Provincial Park.
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for Douglas Provincial Park, as part of the seasonal start up of the waterworks. This advisory is for any individual who may access water from the park distribution system. This advisory is in effect until testing results confirm the safety of the drinking water.
Expires: 2019-05-14T16:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Saskatchewan Provincial Parks, 2019-05-08T08:59:46-06:00, F15E6874-0D0E-F31F-1171-4C4D7D27B3B1
Area: Douglas Provincial Park, including Coghlan, Middaugh and Homestead campgrounds and Store By The Shore.
properties.Author: SK Saskatchewan Provincial Parks

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rainfall amounts of 30 to 50 millimetres are expected through Saturday morning. A low pressure system from the American Midwest will bring rain beginning on Thursday over Western Quebec, and move into Central Quebec on Friday. Since spring freshet has not ended in some areas, flooding is possible in the most vulnerable areas. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall expected Thursday night and Friday. A strong low pressure system will track over Northeastern Ontario on Thursday. Rain ahead of this system will begin Thursday afternoon before tapering to scattered showers Friday night. Total rainfall amounts of 20 to 40 mm are possible with the heaviest rain falling Thursday night. The ground, already near saturation, has a lessened ability to absorb further rainfall. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local conservation authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District Office. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-09T04:46:03-00:00

properties.Summary:

Rain ahead of this system will begin early Thursday morning before tapering to scattered showers Friday. Total rainfall amounts of 20 to 40 mm are possible with the heaviest rain falling Thursday during the day and into the evening. The ground, already near saturation, has a lessened ability to absorb further rainfall. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local conservation authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District Office. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Very strong southwest winds gusting to 100 km/h have been reported to the lee of the St. Elias Mountains near Destruction Bay and are also possible near Haines Junction. These winds are expected to persist through the early evening and then gradually diminish. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-09T08:20:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-08T23:54:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4055034645.2019
Area: Kluane Lake, Haines Junction
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Ice build-up due to freezing rain is expected or occurring. A warm front passing over Paulatuk will bring freezing rain to the region this evening and overnight. Freezing rain will change over to snow Thursday morning. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-09T06:31:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-08T21:32:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3987258686.2019
Area: Paulatuk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures will drop slightly below the freezing mark over these areas tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-09T11:18:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-08T19:19:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3282066616.2019
